page.title: 19Pipewell Village-Houses
page.content: The total population of Pipewell is only about 67 people, living in approximately 15 houses. Most of the houses are old, detached and well kept with beautiful gardens running parallel to the main street. Lead windows are especially popular in this village. The old post office closed about 20 years ago, and now keeps the key to the church next door. There is a plaque on the old school dated 1880, but this is now a house which has been updated into a modern pebble-dash cottage. There is a row of terraced cottages at right angles to the street next to a telephone and post box. There are three footpaths to Great Oakley, Kettering and Wilbarston. The village has its own private bus which drives the children each day to Rushton School.
